{include "affiliate_loader"} A bill attacking trans students in Missouri is headed to the floor of the Missouri House. {include "pre-header-spacing"}{beacon}

{include "default_salutation"} –

I know you – along with thousands of Missourians – have been speaking out against the relentless attacks on transgender youth. This time a constitutional amendment to ban trans youth from participating in the sports they love is on the move. HJR 53 could be on the floor of the Missouri House as soon as next week.

We cannot let this happen. Trans students belong on the sports team they identify with. Call 1-866-572-7042 to tell your representative to vote no on HJR 53.

Trans students participate in sports for the same reasons other young people do: to challenge themselves, improve fitness, and be part of a team. Excluding trans students deprives them of opportunities available to their peers and sends the message that they are not worthy of a full life. The proposed laws are nothing more than an attempt to codify discrimination and demonize differences.

Trans students have successfully participated in school sports consistent with their gender identity for years. Leading advocates for women's sports support inclusion of women and girls who are transgender and warn that these efforts will ultimately harm all athletes in women's sports. The marginalization of trans student athletes is rooted in the same kind of gender discrimination and stereotyping that has held back women athletes.

Our lawmakers should be focused on protecting all of Missouri's children by creating safe and welcoming environments so they can learn and thrive, not launch baseless attacks aimed to push trans kids to the margins. Call your lawmaker now at 1-866-572-7042: not only does HJR 53 discriminate against trans youth in ways that compromise their health, social and emotional development, and safety, but it violates federal constitutional guarantees of equal protection.

In solidarity,
